record.title: Playmakers, circa 1974
record.descri: Document designating UNC's PlayMaker's Theatre a National Historic Landmark, ca.1974. Document states that it "...possesses national significance in commemorating the History of the United States of America". Document bears the logos of the U.S. Dept. of Interior and the National Park Service and is signed by Ronald D. Walker, director of the National Park Service, and Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior. Dimensions: 35.5 x 27.9 cm.
record.subjea: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.; United States. National Park Service.; United States. Dept. of the Interior.
record.usage: This item is presented courtesy of the North Carolina Collection at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill for research and educational purposes. Prior permission from the North Carolina Collection is required for any commercial use.

record.title: World War II ration book, 1943
record.descri: World War II ration book. Consists of a square, green papered booklet with two pockets on the front. At bottom right corner of book is gold-colored text reading, "DELL'S JEWEL BOX / 167 E. FRANKLIN ST. / CHAPEL HILL, NORTH CAROLINA" with a small golden image of a diamond above the writing. The front pocket contains six small cards; the first is manila and at top reads "'A' Basic Gasoline Ration" in black lettering with the number "895626" in red to the right, the rest of the card has blue inked script identifying the owner as Mr. Albert Coates, including his address and the details of his vehicle. Other cards are light blue, read "'B' Supplemental Mileage Ration" in green and contain information concerning Mr. Albert Coates. The last card is manila, reads "Mileage Ration Identification Folder," has the same information about Coates, and opens up to instructions written in black concerning the rations. The main pocket contains four manila ration cards and one Certificate of Registrar. Each ration book contains several small blue stamps redeemable for various items. Dimensions: Booklet is 6.25" (16cm) in width and 4.5" (11.5cm) in length.

record.title: Tiffany's pillbox
record.descri: Commemorative pillbox made by Tiffany's for UNC's Bicentennial celebration, circa 1989. The outside of the pillbox is enamel on copper with gold trim, depicting buildings on the UNC campus. The inside lid of the box reads, "The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Bicentennial." The pillbox is trademarked by Halycon Days enamels, a joint venture which began in 1970 of the Halcyon Days antique shop and Bilston and Battersea Enamels. The pillbox is a recreation of the style of enameling practiced in Georgian times. This particular pillbox was designed and sold by Tiffany & Co. Housed in light blue double boxes, with the outer box labeled "Tiffany & Co." and the inner box featuring the "Halcyon Days Enamels" trademark, lined inside with white velour to cushion the box. Dimensions: 6.2 cm. wide, 5.0 cm high, 2.0 cm deep.
record.subjea: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
